item.title: OPPO Reno 13 series launched with MediaTek D 8350 chip: Check price, specs - Business Standard
item.description:
OPPO Reno 13 Series Launched with MediaTek D 8350 Chip

Publication Date: Jan 09 2025 | Source: Business Standard

China's OPPO has launched its Reno 13 series in India, which includes Reno 13 and Reno 13 Pro smartphones, powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 8350 System-on-Chip.

  • Reno 13 price starts at Rs 37,999; Reno 13 Pro starts at Rs 49,999.
  • Smartphones feature Android 15-based ColorOS 15 with AI imaging tools.
  • Available for pre-order with open sales starting on January 11, 2025.
  • Customers can get discounts and exchange bonuses during the launch period.
“The Reno 13 series smartphones are equipped with AI-driven features designed to enhance the user experience in imaging and productivity.”

In conclusion, the OPPO Reno 13 series combines advanced technology with attractive pricing, poised to capture consumer interest.

item.title: Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma: 'He Leads From The Front' - News18
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Predicts India's Next Captain After Rohit Sharma: 'He Leads From The Front'

Publication Date: January 09, 2025
Source: News18

Legendary former cricketer Sunil Gavaskar believes that Jasprit Bumrah is set to become India's next captain after Rohit Sharma, possibly in the near future. Gavaskar praises Bumrah for his leadership qualities.

  • Gavaskar mentioned that Bumrah leads from the front and supports his bowlers without putting pressure on them.
  • Bumrah has already captained India in key matches during the 2024-25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • The future of Rohit Sharma as captain is under scrutiny after India's series loss in Australia.
  • The BCCI is expected to review the captaincy soon, with Bumrah as the leading candidate.
  • Concerns about Bumrah's workload may affect his captaincy role, given he is a key player in all formats.
“He could be the next man. I think he will be the next man. Because he leads from the front.” - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, as India grapples with leadership changes, Bumrah stands out as a capable and supportive leader, although his workload management will be crucial moving forward.

item.title: Sonu Sood says he is 'not on talking terms' with Kangana Ranaut after 'Manikarnika': 'I feel that it’s he - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Sonu Sood Reveals Rift with Kangana Ranaut After 'Manikarnika'

Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Actor Sonu Sood has opened up about his ongoing feud with Kangana Ranaut, confirming they are 'not on talking terms' following his departure from the film 'Manikarnika: The Queen Of Jhansi'.

  • The rift began in 2019 when Sonu left the film due to professional commitments.
  • Despite the estrangement, Sonu remains close to Kangana's family.
  • He prefers not to speak negatively about former friends and acknowledges feeling hurt by some of Kangana’s remarks.
  • Sonu stated that there have been unsuccessful attempts by a mutual friend to reconcile their relationship.
“I feel that it’s her foolishness... I have no regrets and choose not to respond to such comments.”

In conclusion, the personal and professional separation between Sonu Sood and Kangana Ranaut highlights the complexities of relationships in the film industry.

item.title: Adani Wilmar's OFS for 20% stake opens January 10, floor price Rs 275 per share - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Adani Wilmar's OFS for 20% stake opens January 10, floor price Rs 275 per share

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Adani Commodities is set to sell up to 20% of its stake in Adani Wilmar through an Offer For Sale (OFS) commencing on January 10, with a floor price of Rs 275 per share.

  • OFS will involve a base offer of 13.5% equity with a green shoe option for another 6.5% share.
  • The sale includes 17.54 crore shares, reserving 25% for mutual funds and insurance companies.
  • Multiple brokers are facilitating the OFS, including ICICI Securities and Jefferies.
  • Shares of Adani Wilmar are currently trading at Rs 324, down 13% from last year.
"Adani Commodities LLP will be selling 17.54 crore shares as the Base Offer on January 10 and 13."

The upcoming OFS represents a strategic move for Adani Commodities, aiming to restructure its equity distribution while providing investment opportunities to stakeholders.

item.title: Polio cases in Pakistan continue to rise, tally reaches 69 - ETHealthWorld
item.description:
Polio Cases in Pakistan Surge to 69, Raising Health Concerns

Published on Jan 9, 2025 by ANI

The recent rise in polio cases in Pakistan is alarming, with the total tally reaching 69 as new cases continue to emerge, particularly in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

  • A new case reported in Tank, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, adds to the urgency of ongoing vaccination efforts.
  • Highest concentration of cases reported in Balochistan (27 cases), Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (21), and Sindh (19).
  • Polio remains endemic in Pakistan and Afghanistan, posing a significant health risk, especially for children under five.
"Polio remains a grave health challenge for Pakistan, with various factors delaying progress in eradication efforts."

Addressing the polio outbreak is critical, emphasizing the necessity for comprehensive vaccination campaigns and public education to combat vaccine hesitancy.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal asks EC to bar Parvesh Verma from Delhi election, 'raid his house' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Demands Action Against BJP's Parvesh Verma Ahead of Delhi Elections

Publication Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Arvind Kejriwal, chief of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), has called for the Election Commission to bar BJP candidate Parvesh Verma from the Delhi assembly elections, citing allegations of corrupt practices.

  • Kejriwal accuses Verma of distributing money and organizing job camps in violation of election rules.
  • He urges for an investigation into fake voter registrations and cancellations in the constituency.
  • Kejriwal alleges a broader scheme involving fake applications from individuals purportedly in their names.
  • The Delhi assembly elections are set for February 5, with vote counting on February 8.
“The BJP candidate in the New Delhi Assembly constituency, Parvesh Verma, is organising job camps, openly distributing money... These things come under corrupt practices.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The AAP leader emphasizes the need for action from the Election Commission to ensure fair electoral practices.

item.title: Consume Coffee In The Morning To Boost Longevity Says Study - NDTV
item.description:
Consume Coffee In The Morning To Boost Longevity Says Study

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

A new study by researchers at the University of Coimbra in Portugal adds to the positive narrative, suggesting that regular coffee consumption may extend a person's healthy lifespan by an average of 1.8 years.

  • The study was supported by the Institute for Scientific Information on Coffee (ISIC).
  • Researchers examined over 50 prior studies to explore the impact of coffee on lifespan.
  • Moderate coffee consumption is linked to improved cardiovascular health and reduced risks of various diseases.
  • Potential health benefits of coffee include protective effects against metabolic syndrome, neurodegenerative diseases, and certain cancers.
  • Coffee is also associated with improved mood and enhanced physical performance.
  • Moderation is key, with about 3-4 cups per day recommended for optimal benefits.
“Studies suggest that regular coffee consumption is associated with a longer healthy lifespan, likely due to its cumulative protective effects on various organs and systems in the body.”

While the benefits of coffee are promising, they vary based on individual health conditions and lifestyle factors.

item.title: In rare interview, Joe Biden says he could have defeated Donald Trump - The Hindu
item.description:
In rare interview, Joe Biden says he could have defeated Donald Trump

Date: January 9, 2025 Source: The Hindu

In a rare interview, President Joe Biden revealed he believes he could have won reelection against Donald Trump, despite being uncertain about serving another full term.

  • Biden expressed confidence in possibly winning the presidential race, citing unspecified polling.
  • He acknowledged his age might have influenced his decision to not seek reelection.
  • Discussed his regrets over misinformation and infrastructure planning during his presidency.
  • Confirmed he is considering preemptive pardons for individuals at risk due to Trump’s policies.
  • Stressed his desired legacy of restoring the economy and reestablishing U.S. leadership globally.
“I really thought I had the best chance of beating him... But I also wasn't looking to be president when I was 85 years old, 86 years old.” - Joe Biden

The interview sheds light on Biden's reflections as he prepares to leave office, along with his aspirations for how he will be remembered.

item.title: Tirupati stampede survivors recall horror: 'For 5 mins, we thought all of us were dead' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Survivors of Tirupati Stampede Share Their Harrowing Experience

Date: January 9, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The tragic stampede at Tirupati on January 8 resulted in at least six fatalities and numerous injuries, as survivors recounted their terrifying experiences during the chaotic incident.

  • Six people lost their lives and nearly 40 were injured in the stampede.
  • The incident was triggered by large crowds jostling for Vaikunta Dwara Sarva Darshan tokens.
  • Witnesses reported that the sudden opening of the gates led to a surge that caused the stampede.
  • Survivors described feelings of fear and helplessness, fearing for their lives during the incident.
“For five minutes, we thought all of us were dead,” said D Venkata Lakshmi, a survivor.

The stampede raises serious concerns about crowd management and safety measures at such large gatherings.

item.title: Mukesh Ambani makes BIG move, Jio launches 5.5G network, more advanced than 5G, superfast internet will run a - India.com
item.description:
Jio Launches Advanced 5.5G Network Under Mukesh Ambani's Leadership

Publication Date: October 2024 | Source: India.com

Reliance Jio, India’s largest telecom company, has introduced its advanced 5.5G network, offering superfast internet speeds of up to 10Gbps. This significant upgrade enhances connectivity and network reliability for users.

Key Points

  • Jio's 5.5G network offers faster downloads up to 10Gbps and uploads up to 1Gbps.
  • The network features lower latency and improved reliability compared to 5G.
  • Exclusive to OnePlus 13 series smartphones, designed for seamless integration.
  • Demonstrations showcased impressive download speeds; up to 1,014.86 Mbps on the 3CC carrier.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

"The 5.5G service revolutionizes the online experience for users, enhancing streaming, gaming, and work functionalities." - Jio Representative

Jio's 5.5G network is set to redefine internet experiences across India.

item.title: Equity fund inflows jump 15% to Rs 41,156 cr in Dec, SIP book tops Rs 26,000 cr mark: AMFI - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Equity Fund Inflows Increase 15% to Rs 41,156 Crores in December

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Open-ended equity mutual fund inflows surged by 14.5% to Rs 41,156 crore in December 2024, with small-cap and thematic funds driving higher investments, according to AMFI.

  • In December, the SIP contribution surpassed Rs 26,000 crore for the first time, reaching Rs 26,459 crore.
  • The total AUM of SIPs was reported at Rs 13.63 lakh crore.
  • Equity fund inflows previously peaked at Rs 41,887 crore in October, despite market volatility.
“Despite volatile market conditions, equity-oriented schemes continued to see strong inflows,” said Venkat Chalasani, CEO of AMFI.

The strong inflows depict a rising trend in investor confidence and a commitment to long-term investment goals, indicating a maturing investor base.

item.title: Indian temple stampede: six dead as thousands jostle for free passes - Reuters India
item.description:
Indian temple stampede: six dead as thousands jostle for free passes

Date: Jan 9, 2023 Source: Reuters

The tragic stampede occurred near the Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple in Andhra Pradesh as thousands gathered for free visit passes, resulting in six fatalities and over 30 injuries.

  • Thousands attended the temple for auspicious visits, contributing to overcrowding.
  • The stampede unfolded when a gate was opened, leading to a push from around 2,500 people.
  • Local authorities are investigating the causes behind the incident.
  • The temple, which generally sells tickets online for 300 rupees, had set up on-site counters for pass issuance.
  • Political backlash followed, with opposition party blaming government administration.
  • Prime Minister Modi extended condolences, affirming sympathy for the victims' families.
"My thoughts are with those who have lost their near and dear ones." - Prime Minister Narendra Modi

The incident highlights the need for better crowd management during large gatherings, particularly at religious sites.

item.title: Virat Kohli To Play County Cricket Ahead Of England Tests? Report Makes Stunning Claim - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Virat Kohli To Play County Cricket Ahead Of England Tests? Report Makes Stunning Claim

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 Source: NDTV

Indian cricket star Virat Kohli is reportedly considering playing County cricket to prepare for the upcoming Test series in England, following a challenging outing in Australia.

  • Kohli scored only 190 runs in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.
  • Former captain Faf du Plessis expressed confidence in Kohli's ability to bounce back, noting his motivation.
  • The potential County stint might conflict with the IPL schedule.
“That is very, very personal. No one can speak to you about when that time is (up) as a player, you'll know,” - Faf du Plessis

Kohli aims to overcome recent struggles and return to form ahead of crucial matches in England.

item.title: Premeal consumption of pistachios benefits prediabetic adults: study - The Hindu
item.description:
Premeal consumption of pistachios benefits prediabetic adults: study

Published: January 09, 2025 03:20 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

A study has found that consuming pistachios as a premeal supplement twice a day showed significant improvements in glycemic control in prediabetic Indian adults.

  • The study, led by V. Mohan from Madras Diabetes Research Foundation, involved a 12-week clinical trial.
  • Participants consumed 30 grams of pistachios before breakfast and dinner.
  • Significant improvements included lower glycosylated haemoglobin levels and reduced post-meal blood glucose levels.
  • Other health benefits noticed were a 10% reduction in triglycerides and decrease in waist circumference.
  • The results suggest benefits in preventing progression to type 2 diabetes.
Dr. Mohan stated, 'These findings suggest potential benefits in preventing the progression to type 2 diabetes.'

The study highlights the potential of pistachios in managing prediabetes, complementing earlier research on the benefits of other nuts.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal wants inclusion of Delhi Jats in Central OBC list, BJP questions timing - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Demands Inclusion of Delhi Jats in OBC List Amidst Political Tensions

Publication Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Aam Aadmi Party convenor Arvind Kejriwal has called for the inclusion of Delhi's Jat community in the Centre's Other Backward Classes (OBC) list, questioning the discrepancy in reservation rights between Delhi Jats and those from Rajasthan.

  • Kejriwal accused the Central government of misleading the Jat community for the past decade.
  • He highlighted promises made by BJP leaders regarding OBC inclusion, which remain unfulfilled.
  • Kejriwal noted that Jat students from Delhi face barriers in securing admission to Delhi University due to lack of OBC status.
  • He emphasized the need for inclusion to ensure job and college admission reservations for Delhi's Jat community.
  • The BJP responded, questioning Kejriwal's sudden interest in the Jat community ahead of elections.
“This is nothing but betrayal. The Centre must include Delhi's Jat community in the OBC list.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The ongoing political discourse surrounding the demand emphasizes the importance of the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.

item.title: Top three images from BepiColombo's sixth Mercury flyby - European Space Agency
item.description:
Top Three Images from BepiColombo's Sixth Mercury Flyby

Date: 09/01/2025 Source: European Space Agency

On 8 January 2025, the ESA/JAXA BepiColombo mission successfully completed its sixth flyby of Mercury, providing stunning images that reveal icy craters and vast sunlit plains.

  • The spacecraft flew just 295 km above Mercury's surface on its dark night side.
  • The close-up images unveil icy craters at the planet's north pole, possibly containing frozen water.
  • This flyby marks the end of the M-CAM cameras' close views of Mercury before the mission's orbiters enter orbit in late 2026.
“BepiColombo's main mission phase may only start two years from now, but all six of its flybys have given us invaluable new information about the little-explored planet.” - Geraint Jones, BepiColombo's Project Scientist at ESA.

The mission continues to unveil the mysteries of Mercury as it prepares for its entry into orbit in two years.

item.title: India Champions Trophy squad announcement: Experts spark Rahul vs Pant debate; Selectors to decide fate on Jan 11, Live - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India Champions Trophy Squad Announcement Live

Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee is set to announce India’s 15-member squad for the Champions Trophy amidst debates on player selections, particularly regarding Rishabh Pant and KL Rahul.

  • Selectors meeting scheduled for January 11.
  • Controversy around Rishabh Pant's place in the squad after his inconsistent ODI performances.
  • Experts suggest KL Rahul as the first-choice wicketkeeper, backed by former players.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's participation is subject to medical clearance after a back injury.
  • Rohit Sharma likely to retain captaincy despite scrutiny over his recent performance.
“Pant was away from cricket for a long time. ... KL Rahul should be your first-choice keeper.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

As the announcement date approaches, discussions grow around the selection of key players, especially with India's recent disappointing Test performances.

item.title: "Out Of Order, Should Be Banned": Ex-England Star Blasts Virat Kohli. Reason Is... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Out Of Order, Should Be Banned: Ex-England Star Blasts Virat Kohli. Reason Is...

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

Former England fast bowler Steve Harmison criticized Virat Kohli's on-field behavior during a match against Australia, suggesting he should have faced a ban for his actions.

  • Harmison argues Kohli's physical altercation with Sam Konstas crossed a line.
  • He warns Konstas to avoid provoking players and focus on improving his batting technique.
  • Harmison expresses concern about the pressures of the Ashes compared to playing against India.
“What happened with Kohli there – Kohli was bang out of order. Virat Kohli should have been banned for what he did.” - Steve Harmison

The controversy sparked by Harmison's comments reflects the ongoing tensions and expectations surrounding cricket's competitive spirit.

item.title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025: ICC delegation makes a shocking landing in Karachi to review preparations - Cricket Addictor
item.description:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025: ICC Delegation Reviews Preparations in Karachi

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The International Cricket Council (ICC) delegation has arrived in Karachi to inspect the preparations for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 scheduled to start on February 19.

  • Inspection of the Karachi National Stadium is underway to ensure it meets standards for the prestigious event.
  • A major focus is on the construction of a new five-story building at the stadium for tournament infrastructure.
  • The opening ceremony and first match featuring Pakistan and New Zealand will take place on February 19, 2025.
  • The stadium is set to host a total of three matches during the tournament.
  • The ICC delegation's visit is part of ongoing inspections prior to the tournament, with previous visits conducted by key ICC personnel.
  • Concerns have been raised regarding the readiness of major stadiums in Pakistan amidst reports of incomplete preparations.
  • The PCB has reassured that renovations will be completed on time despite worries from social media and reports.
“The preparations for the Champions Trophy 2025 are on track.” - PCB Spokesperson

The ICC Champions Trophy 2025 is an important event for cricket in Pakistan, and inspections are crucial to ensure that all facilities meet international standards.

item.title: Tirupati Darshan stampede: Nearly 1.20 lakh ‘Vaikunta Dwara Darshan’ tokens at Tirumala temple exhausted in whiff - The Hindu
item.description:
Tirupati Darshan stampede: Nearly 1.20 lakh ‘Vaikunta Dwara Darshan’ tokens at Tirumala temple exhausted in whiff

Published: January 09, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The tokens for the first three days of the ten-day ‘Vaikunta Dwara Darshan’ at Tirumala Sri Venkateswara temple were exhausted shortly after the counters opened. This surge in demand followed a tragic stampede incident that resulted in the death of six devotees.

  • 1.20 lakh tokens were issued at five additional centers in Tirupati for the Vaikunta Ekadasi event.
  • The distribution began earlier than scheduled due to crowd control after the stampede.
  • The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) plans to reopen token counters on January 12 for subsequent darshan.
“Normalcy returned after the stampede and 1.20 lakh tokens were exhausted within a few hours.”

The event highlights ongoing challenges in managing large crowds at significant religious gatherings.

item.title: Protesting farmer consumes poison at Shambhu border, dies at Patiala hospital - The Times of India
item.description:
Farmer Dies After Consuming Poison During Protest at Shambhu Border

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

A tragic incident occurred at the Shambhu border where a protesting farmer consumed poison, leading to his death at a Patiala hospital.

  • The farmer was part of ongoing protests.
  • He succumbed to his condition shortly after arriving at the hospital.
  • This incident raises concerns about the mental and emotional toll of the protests on farmers.
"This incident highlights the distress faced by the farmers involved in the protests."

This event is a stark reminder of the challenges facing farmers and the importance of addressing their grievances to prevent similar tragedies.
